forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Sunny. High near 65, with temperatures falling to around 62 in the afternoon. West southwest wind around 22 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 52. West southwest wind 12 to 21 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph.

weather_report:
In Downtown San Francisco, the sun bathes the landscape in a warm glow this afternoon, offering a respite from the usual cool and fog-laden skies. With temperatures dancing around a pleasant 65 degrees, the gentle west-southwest breeze provides a refreshing accompaniment, making it a delightful time to be outdoors. The fog, while often a character of the San Francisco skyline, seems to have retreated, allowing for expansive views of the city and its iconic landmarks. The atmosphere appears clear, punctuated by the outlines of the Golden Gate Bridge etched against the cerulean sky.

As twilight approaches, the evening promises a transition to partly cloudy skies, where the temperature will settle comfortably around 52 degrees. Winds will remain a constant companion, niggling but pleasant, as they carry hints of the ocean’s crispness. For those preparing to venture out, a light jacket will serve well, offering just enough warmth against the evening chill while allowing one to appreciate the subtle changing colors of the sky. With these conditions at hand, an evening stroll through the softly lit streets or a quiet moment in a local café becomes a lovely pursuit, inviting both reflection and connection in the heart of the city.
